renew.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to arrange for an agreement or official document to continue for a further period of time
renew.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I need to renew my passport this year.
renew.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to begin doing something again after a period of not doing it
renew.translation[0].definitions[1].note: renew a friendship/acquaintance etc (=become friendly with someone again)
renew.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Local people have renewed their efforts to save the school.
Police renewed their appeal for witnesses.
renew.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to remove something that is old or broken and put a new one in its place
renew.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The window frames need to be renewed.
renew.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to arrange for an existing contract, agreement, deal etc to continue
renew.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Most airlinesrenew theirinsurance policies between July and October.
The original contract had a term of three years, with an option to renew for two more.
renew.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to begin to do something again, after a period of time
renew.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: If oil prices remain high, U.S. industry will renew efforts to conserve energy.
The company is renewing its focus on customer satisfaction.
